intro: Oxalis refracta var. erecta, commonly known as the upright wood sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive white veins and produces clusters of five-petaled yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 6 to 12 inches and thrives in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks, where it forms dense ground cover. Oxalis refracta var. erecta is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and flowers.
